com.bumptech.glide.resize
Class ImageManager

java.lang.Object
  com.bumptech.glide.resize.ImageManager

public class ImageManager
extends java.lang.Object

A class to coordinate image loading, resizing, recycling, and caching. Depending on the provided options and the sdk version, uses a combination of an LRU disk cache and an LRU memory cache to try to reduce the number of load and resize operations performed and to maximize the number of times Bitmaps are recycled as opposed to allocated. If no options are given defaults to using both a memory and a disk cache and to recycling bitmaps if possible.

Note that Bitmap recycling is only available on Honeycomb and up.

Method Detail

getSafeMemoryCacheSize

public static int getSafeMemoryCacheSize(android.content.Context context)
Get the maximum safe memory cache size for this particular device based on the # of mb allocated to each app. This is a conservative estimate that has been safe for 2.2+ devices consistently. It is probably rather small for newer devices.

Parameters:
context - A context
Returns:
The maximum safe size for the memory cache for this devices in bytes

getPhotoCacheDir

public static java.io.File getPhotoCacheDir(android.content.Context context)
Try to get the external cache directory if available and default to the internal. Use a default name for the cache directory if no name is provided

Parameters:
context - A context
Returns:
A File representing the default disk cache directory

getPhotoCacheDir

public static java.io.File getPhotoCacheDir(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.lang.String cacheName)
Try to get the external cache directory if available and default to the internal. Use a default name for the cache directory if no name is provided

Parameters:
context - A context
cacheName - The name of the subdirectory in which to store the cache
Returns:
A File representing the default disk cache directory

getBitmapPool

public BitmapPool getBitmapPool()
Get the BitmapPool this ImageManager is using. If Bitmap recycling is not supported, an BitmapPoolAdapter will be returned. For the pool to be useful you must return a bitmap to the pool for every bitmap you obtain from the pool.

Note the BitmapPool api is likely to change in the near future to support some new features released in KitKat.

Returns:
The bitmap pool.

getImage

public ImageManager.LoadToken getImage(BitmapLoadTask task,
                                       LoadedCallback cb)
Loads an image.

Parameters:
task - A BitmapLoadTask that will be used to fetch and decode an image if it is not cached.
cb - A LoadedCallback to call when the image is ready.
Returns:
An ImageManagerJob that must be retained while the job is still relevant and that can be used to cancel a job if the image is no longer needed.

releaseBitmap

public void releaseBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap b)
Notify the ImageManager that a Bitmap it loaded is no longer being used and decrement the reference counter for that Bitmap. This will cause an exception if acquire was not called first, or if each call to release does not come after a call to acquire. If the reference count drops to zero, places the Bitmap into a queue to be recycled. Does nothing if recycling is disabled or impossible.

Parameters:
b - The releasedBitmap

clearMemory

public void clearMemory()

public void trimMemory(int level)

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down all of the background threads used by the ImageManager including the executor service
